intro: Dodecahema leptoceras, commonly known as the slender-leaved dodecahema, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
